resources.string: Have you heard about %1$s? Check it out! #bitotsav_19 #colours_of_asia\n%2$s
Students of BIT Mesra: Visit 192.168.101.17:8080 from local network to verify.\n\n Others: Collect your night passes from the info desk.
Pay for and collect merchandise at the info desk.
Report at info desk to get accommodation details.

Deemed as an institute of national importance, Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra, is one of the country\'s most honourable and distinguished educational university. It was founded and established by the visionary industrialist, B.M. Birla over more than six decades ago, and has been creating waves of success ever since. The massive 850 acre campus has been home to diverse cultures, multitudinous talent, and inspiring leaders.\n\n
BIT Mesra has not only produced some of the finest technocrats in the country, but has also churned out winners in professions as diverse as music, art, and literature. Our annual cultural extravaganza, BITOTSAV, is an affluent celebration of the rich cultural heritage that resides in our country, and an attempt to revel in the euphoric essence of India\'s cultural potency. BITOTSAV has a plethora of events to realize its cause of bringing students from all spheres and from all places, together, to enjoy culture while supporting something of societal importance. As the grandeur of BITOTSAV keeps on growing, this year\'s BITOTSAV is set to be majestic: bigger and better than ever before. With enthralling events, mesmerizing nights, enticing performances by prominent celebrities and a whole lot of dance and music, we welcome you to BITOTSAV19.

‚ÄúWe are, at almost every point of our day, immersed in cultural diversity: faces, clothes, smells, attitudes, values, traditions, behaviours, beliefs, rituals.‚Äù

- Randa Abdel-Fattah 


From the ‚ÄòKhokhloma‚Äô painting symbolizing the high importance of forests and nature in Russian culture and its history; to ‚ÄòLiwa‚Äô the traditional dance performed in Eastern Arabia; from the traditional Chinese ‚ÄòQipao‚Äô dress, to over 720 dialects and 22 official languages in India; form ‚Äòyakuniku‚Äô a Japanese style of cooking, to ‚ÄòTeochew opera‚Äô in Singapore; a deep vein of history courses through all the countries of Asia. Culture has ever since been the lifeblood of any vibrant society to tell their stories, celebrate, remember the past, entertain and envisage the future. The variant forms of art, architecture and language, folk music, invigorating dance and eclectic cuisines, marks off even various regions in a country characterizing their inherent traditional origin through different civilizations. Melding of culture and traditions through globalisation and technological advances have increased their historically grounded and validated contributions and brought about much needed futuristic changes. Through the theme ‚ÄúCelebration of Cultures-Colours of Asia‚Äù BITOTSAV‚Äô19 procures to contribute in its own distinctive way to celebrate the rich, large, complex and variegated cultures of humanity.

Pertaining from birth or caused through unavoidable circumstances or accident, disability has always been considered as a character to endow compassion, pity and empathy. While throughout the world many changes have taken place in status and treatment of persons with disabilities, the remnants of tradition and past belief influence present-day practices affecting such groups. Even today, our country has about 30 million handicaps, out of which 50% are uneducated. In a society embracing illiteracy and apartheid on grounds of one‚Äôs physical disabilities, the situations of the incapacitated are still in dire straits. Discriminative attitude can stigmatize persons with disabilities, imposing artificial limitations upon them, denying them equal opportunities for development and living, and inequitably demoting them to second-class citizens to be pitied.\n\n
Started back in 1960, the Disability Rights Movement has thrived to bring forth a change in the world by breaking institutional, physical and societal barriers that had been preventing people with disabilities from living their lives like other citizens. This BITOTSAV we pledge to part take in and contribute our bit to secure equal opportunities and equal rights for all people with disabilities.

If we trace the trails of time, we come across various art forms, be it music, dance or the fine arts, which have, over time, lost their sheen and significance. But their grandeur and pageantry are unparalleled. India has, since time immemorial, been a country which has boasted of unity in diversity and the multifarious nature of our country is exhibited in its rich cultural heritage. But due to modernisation, this vibrant culture is getting lost. From the Madhubani painting of Bihar to he Toda embroidery of the Nilgiri hills, these art forms, which show us our glorious past are gradually attriting and it is about time that we do something about it. In an effort to revive the the magnificence of our rich culture, we at BITOTSAV\'19 have pledged to bring to the fore, such art forms via various awareness campaigns, workshops and talks.

To acquaint one and all with this term, a Netizen is a general word that is used for any person that uses the internet. A responsible Netizen is one who abides by the rules of the online world. Of course, the internet is not restricted to a set of rules and regulations, and is subject to use as and how desired by the end consumer. This is where the concept of responsible Netizenship kicks in. A responsible netizen, is a person who has a moral approach towards the usage of the internet: one who respects the online community, and abides by the so called \'Netiquettes\'.\n\n
To spread awareness regarding the same, this year\'s social campaign for BITOTSAV is chosen as Responsible Netizenship. As the usage of internet increases manifold, it becomes imperative to ensure that people use it with a certain sense of responsibility. The entire BITOTSAV\'19 team will strive to ensure that people learn about the duties and responsibilities of a netizen, and urge others to do the same. As the usage of the internet is increasing manifold, it is very imperative to be responsible whilst using it. The entire BITOTSAV\'19 team will strive to ensure that people learn about the duties and responsibilities of a netizen, and urge others to do the same.

These mellifluous lines from our Heritage Night star are the perfect depiction of his style, simple yet heart wrenching. His storytelling includes poetry inspired from the most quotidian things, expressed in the most lucid yet poignant manner. His cadence has often left people awe struck. From jibber-jabber on friendship to failed mass bunk executions; from woes of mess food to the bittersweet experiences of love and adulting, be there at the G. P. Birla auditorium on February 14, 2019 to watch Amandeep Singh express stories relating to these and much more with his poetry. Make sure that you do not miss this for the world!

Have you ever felt the heat of electric beats echoing in your soul? The magnetic moments circuited via electrifying performances are soon to become a regular in your life as BITOTSAV\'19 is here. Yes, we come doing ‚ÄúCharchebaazi‚Äù about the band night which comes with some huge acts that promise to keep you rocking all night. BITOTSAV\'19 turns up the volume of excitement along with a license to go nuts for the amazing band, \'Moongphali\', a band which has an image of rampimg up the crowd with its sharp and catchy melodies.The bandwagon is filled with awardees who have thrilled the audience with songs like \'Dil se\',\' Humma\' and \'Kabira\'. So mark the dates and get ready for the hindi band night, as it\'s time to \'Jee Aao\'!

Revivified with music and soul, BITOTSAV is back for us to savour and relish some striking performances. With some amazing tracks for us to listen to, this year the Band-Nite promises to be bigger and better than ever before. With electric beats, coupled with soul thumping music, we are here, ready to surge the atmosphere with ecstasy, as BITOTSAV\'19 brings to you, a breathtaking display of melody with the band "NAALAYAK"! This band from Chandigarh, considered to be one of the upcoming bands of India, is known for its explosive live acts and pumping music. They are now considered to be the trailbreakers of the genre defining a new era of Indie Rock. So, get ready to be rocked and put your hands up for the incredible band, NAALAYAK! 6:00 p.m. Fusion Arena. Be there!

Electro, techno, house, trance, drum, bass!\n\n
With our carnival of cultures drawing nearer, we can feel your escalating vigour and palpating energies as you restlessly wait to dance and sway to the ebb and flow of music. The wait is finally over as we now reveal one of the EDM artists for BITOTSAV\'19. She was recently ranked as the 3rd best DJ by DJaneMag India and was the official DJ of the RCB team for the last few seasons of IPL. Yes, it is Candice Redding! Register today and ensure your presence at BIT Mesra on February 16th to dance to some spine chilling EDM. Put on your best dancing shoes to groove to reverberant, curated music and segueing tracks and rest assured you will have the most exhilarating rendezvous ever!

From producing remixes and songs in high school days to keeping his passion alive and becoming one of the best DJ in the country, Nikhil Sahni a.k.a NYK has won many hearts and topped numerous charts. A record-breaking three time winner of Vh1 MyFav Awards for India\'s Best Bollywood DJ and with over a million online followers, NYK is known for his unique skill of blending different rhythms to create fresh and enthralling music. With his vibrant energy and musical abilities, he is sure to make the crowd go wild with his heart thumping beats! Be there at BIT Mesra on February 16 to groove to the beats of foot-tapping numbers and witness an electrifying night full of fervour and zest!

With breathtaking compositions illuminating the silhouette of silence and sparkling vivacity throughout, a squallish, power-packed and exhilarating performance is all set to unfurl its opulence in this celebration of cultures.


Embracing the zestful verve that runs in all our veins, BITOTSAV'19 is thrilled to announce the first ‚ÄòPronite‚Äô artist, the ravishing Shalmali Kholgade!


BITOTSAV'19 welcomes you all to witness this blissful fusion of euphonious notes and audacious tunes. Catch her live on 17th February, 2019 in NCC ground and witness her set the stage ablaze with fiery notes and feisty rhythms!

The strings of time have perfectly woven a shroud of anticipation, a cloud of enthralment and a resplendent aura of excitement all around. The sun has finally dawned upon this purple haze of pandemonium, for it is time to set the tone for the biggest, the grandest night of the year!


Ladies and Gentlemen! It's finally time for the most awaited announcement of the festival! With skies glittering with a prismatic streak of euphoria, get ready to witness an ethereal spectacle of symphony and melody as BITOTSAV'19 presents to you the headliners of the Pro Nite, the dazzling duo- 'SACHIN-JIGAR'!


So, get ready to groove your feet to their peppy beats as BITOTSAV'19 welcomes one and all to witness their music create magic on 17th February, 2019 from 6:30 P.M in the Fusion Arena(NCC Ground)!
